title: LIKE I WANT YOU
content:
I’ve thought of deleting them
The poems that show me feeling
Like a snake shed its skin

I wonder was it is a sin
To love someone
While unclean

Did I deserve the pain I felt
Did I deserve the hand I was dealt

Now I see you and your new lover
Everybody happy you’re both together
Where does that leave me

I’m nothing if not unhappy
Unhappy and empty
I feel like the fig tree

You can’t feel
You can’t love
But your eyes brighten from his touch
You smile while he speaks
Your hands linger longer than ours did
Where does that leave me

I hate that I loved you
I hate that I poured myself out
Now I’m empty
I have nothing more to give
I’m all out of pleas
Where did you leave me

Happy birthday Ifeoluwa

title: LAST LAUGH
content:
Seeing you smile
Seeing you laugh

It must be karma finally holding me
For all the other hearts I didn’t set free
Now I’ll always love the one that can’t love me

“Not necessarily “
“Do you think you can move on?”
Saying things that will make me egg on

You probably know I can’t leave too
Every part of me says I’m marrying you
It’s a chase I can’t end
No matter how much my heart bends

It didn’t hurt as much this time
That’s why I still smile with you
What hurt me were the mixed signals
Always saying one with two

I’d rather you break me properly
Than leave me clinging
To a love I might never have
To my endless bleeding

And you smile as you do it
So I can never focus
Your beauty enchants me
Like magic like hocus pocus

I don’t even know what I feel about you
I don’t know if I truly love too
But I know that I yearn for every word you say
Every breath
Every touch
You could easily take me away
There’s nothing you couldnt tell me to do
Aside from stop loving you

Something keeps telling me don’t stop
And I don’t want to
So I’ll keep trying
Until the world knows how much I love you

The Precious journey part two
Who gets the last laugh
Who ends up confused

title: TRUST ISSUES
content:
I hug the pieces of my heart close
Cause it’s the thing I fear the most
A heart that loves to hold
Some people might call gold
Led to stories that should never be told
All because of you

A never ending cycle I go through
To learn how to love you
A price paid by other people
All because of you
It’s not my fault
I’m the victim here
Nobody ever told me
Love wasn’t fair
All because of you

I dived in heart first
Head last
And never came out
Atleast I never touched the ground
I’m still swimming
My hearts still breaking
All because of you

I hate you now
Hate is all my love breeds
And you’re not the first
To make my heart bleed
Maybe the one it bled for the most
But I made sure others bled too
So I won’t be alone
All because of you

They all loved me
Fell in line one by one
And I made myself love them all too
All for fun
Fun isn’t right
It was fear
And it still is
All because of you

Giving my heart to someone
Is a gun to my head
Just one step to
Laying my death bed
You scare me
You terrify me
I’m afraid of you
Frightened by what you could do
All because of you

Please don’t think I’m insecure
I just can’t trust no one else
Please don’t think I’m insecure
I just feel safe by myself
It’s all my fault

title: A MAN THAT WANTS TO MARRY
content:
It’s been so long
But not long enough
On this earth

Where I seek love
Where I seek a friend
Where I seek company
Where I seek my end
Yet seek to be happy

The search and chase
For someone to call my brace
My lover
My friend
My companion
My end

Days when it feels like
I don’t miss a rib
And others when it feels like
I miss two
Love and heart may just be a fluke

A man made concept
To fill our void
A reach made from sadness and being paranoid
Who knows if the rib is already dead
There must’ve been a reason it was shed

A her to my him
My only in between
Proof of love will never be a thing

The one for me might be the two for me
As I’ve learnt to think with my head not heart
Unless women will tear you apart
A rib never loses its sharp point
And I’ve been nothing but a victim
It may have been my fault once or twice
But all for love I have paid the price
And now I’ve lost how to love completely

I can fake it
I’m quite the good actor
Who wouldn’t believe they’re loved
Unless they don’t love themself (me)

Everybody wants it
It’s in endless demand
To feel a love
That is so profound
A heart that burns
And yearns for them
But ice burns too
When you hold it too close to you

I hope I find it
I hope I get it back
The endless worship of love
That I once had

I hope rib still lives
I hope she waits for me
I hope she accepts me
And does not feel sorry

At the end of the day
I’m just a man who wants to marry
